data.text:
We loved our stay at Eden Roc - we were in one of the bungalows. It was clean and in a nice quiet location. 

We stayed for a week which was probably long enough as we were able to do different activities each day. 

Restaurants were great, but make sure you book as soon as you arrive otherwise it can be hard to get in as they are (other than the buffet restaurant) quite small. 

The buffet restaurant had a great selection for breakfast and dinner and it was good quality too. 

Bar staff were great, really friendly and we had a great selection of drinks including premium spirits. 

Having a voucher for the restaurant up in the town was ideal and a highlight for us. 

We hired a car to go to Lindos and took a taxi to Rhodes Old Town - both worth a visit. 

A couple of slight negatives (but certainly didn’t spoil it for us) - ants on one night in our bungalow and the pools were salt water and freezing. That didn’t spoil it for our kids, I’m just getting soft. The ants were dealt with too. Both of those were minor things and wouldn’t stop us returning in future.
data.title: Relaxing family holiday

data.text:
The beach front location of Eden Roc is fantastic, we loved how easy you could flit from the pool to the beach and vice versa. 
Highly recommend taking sea shoes if you’re going in the sea. The sea is clear, great for snorkelling. 
The beach front bar and restaurant is gorgeous. As was the buffet and other Al la carte restaurants. 
Good choice of drinks. 
Evening entertainment is good. 
Rooms were nice, my parents had an upgraded room to us, same layout just more modern. Although ours was dated it was still nice. We requested a quiet room which we got. 
Theres a couple of restaurants and a bar about 5/10 minute walk outside the hotel. Faliraki isn’t too far in a taxi if you are looking for something livelier. 
Visited Rhodes Town for a day and evening, really wasn’t expecting it to be as big as it was, simply stunning area and definitely worth a visit day or night. 
Would return.
data.title: Fab beach front location

data.text:
Stayed here with my wife and mother and father in law. This hotel was recommended by a friend. 

Hotel is very spacious and has an amazing private beach, the grounds around the hotel are really well maintained.

Good selection of food including a la carte restaurants, drinks were ok.

Smallish street of shops and bars within ten minute walk but nothing major. 

Rhodes old town is AMAZING for a day/night out.

Faliraki is worth a visit (even if thats not your scene) it was good for walking around of an evening checking out all the little shops and bars. 

Great for a family holiday.
data.title: Great beach front hotel

data.text:
We have been 3 times and booked to go back again I October this year.
The setting is really pretty especially the beach.
The  different restaurants, food and drinks are supberb, along with the friendly staff.
The entertainment is also good.

The only things I would improve are the rooms which some are getting a little shabby and the having sand instead of shingle on the beach.
data.title: Our favourite hotel

data.text:
A wonderful celebration holiday for my daughter’s 21st. We travelled as a family of 5. 
 The front desk staff were very understanding and kind -they upgraded us to a suite in the main building - where my elderly mum could easily reach all the amenities. The panoramic harbour view from the balcony is a memory we will treasure. 
The a la carte restaurants bookable within the all inclusive put this hotel into a class of its own. The Peruvian, the Teppanyaki and the Greek were our favourites -can’t wait to rebook them next visit.
You get international brands for all inclusive drinks- we visited the wine bar every evening for a glass of fizz, and we  all loved the cocktails. Each a la carte has its own signature cocktail which was a lovely  touch. 
The entire staff group are a credit to the hotel. We had such a wonderful experience we are rebooking for this year.
data.title: Superb hotel, 5* service, 5* food, 5* drinks
